reviews.review: ta weno

Gameplay is okey, but there is nothing else good about this game.

1. No skillbased matchmaking (Killer with 300h versus 4 swf with 3000h each)
2. Errors all the time, even in custom games. Invites often not working, you find a game without your teammate even though you are in the same lobby and, worst part, some errors (especially in custom) completely resets your perks, items, addons and offerings (in custom especially the settings).
3. You get dc:d without the game crashing, still loosin progress towards your rank, and all your items etc...

This game have been on the market for long, but unfortunately the developers are monkeys and get paid for doing a shitass job. Hella nice game :)
fun game, little broken on some perks and skill based match-macking is shit be overall pretty fun

Good horror game!

Hackers, Bubba mains, face camping, ahh. I this game is my crack! So many ways to screw with survivors and killers alike. I never put down this game, tbh the fact you can tame killers like cats and dogs gives and make survivors scream gives me the dopamine I need.

I want to recommend this so badly. There's not many good "Asymmetric" games out there, since the death of Evolve and the failure of Last Year/F13. But this game doesn't know what it wants to be. It doesn't really deliver on its premise - it tries too hard to be competitive and loses out on the "scary". Feels more like an 'esport'-y title than a horror one.

It's also not particularly well-balanced, which is funny because it wants to be so competitive. Some combo of BT, Dead Hard, Iron Will, Kindred (for solo) etc. are almost necessary to play Survivor well, unless you are a god-tier player like Otzdarva. These perks take HOURS of grinding to get, then HOURS of grinding to get on the character you actually want to play.

The grind is ABYSMAL. It takes amazingly long to even get a working loadout bought, and that then you need to earn that loadout on your main(s). Not having those perks makes your performance objectively worse, which makes it harder to grind.

Most of my hours playing on PS4 (before I got it on here) were spent playing the same Distressing BBQ build on the one character I had both perks on, then dumping all the blood points on to other characters to try and earn their good perks. (Anyone remember when Ruin was great?)

Some folks will take the time to learn how to play characters like the Nurse, who breaks the core concept of the game completely. Against a good nurse almost every chase becomes a 50/50. Thankfully, good nurses are rare until you hit red ranks.

This game fails as a competitive outlet, doesn't deliver on the horror premise, and is unbelievably impossibly grindy. Many perks you have to shell out real money for, which doesn't even give you the perk - it gives you the character you can use to "earn" the perk. You can technically get the perk in the "Shrine of Secrets", but if you don't log in weekly to check you may miss the one time Decisive Strike shows up for the next six+ months.

I enjoy this game for some sick, twisted reason, but I can't in good faith recommend it to anyone else. I don't play too often, and when I do I intentionally don't try very hard. I think a move toward casual play would benefit this game greatly. Because right now, it feels like a casual game pretending to be an e-sport, and it only succeeds on the surface-level of being either.

Do not play in its current state. You either stomp noobs and then get paired with people with 6,000 hours literally the next game, or you finally get a good match, and then a blatant cheater holds you hostage in a game you cannot escape from without DCing, for which YOU get a penalty, and they go onto their next match after bragging about cheating in the postgame lobby, because they know that BHVR does not care about cheaters and worst case scenario they make a new account and start up again an hour later.... 
Until BHVR fixes these two huge issues, the game is just not worth putting time into, hopefully VHS learns from DBDs mistakes, until then play a different game and avoid this at all costs.

Viele viele völlig unnötige Fehler im Spiel.
Teilweise bleibt man in der Luft hängen und läuft für gut 2 Sekunden auf der Stelle.
Nur toxische Killer die Campen und Tunneln.
Survivor wären aber angeblich Toxic weil man die Luke direkt öffnen KONNTE, weshalb das erstmal aus dem Spiel entfernt wurde.
Huntress Hitbox ist seit ihrem Release immer noch völlig broken.
Nemesis hat die lächerlichste Hitbox, die ich jemals in irgendeinem Spiel gesehen habe. Wer die erstellt hat sollte seinen Job SOFORT verlieren.

Früher war das Spiel sooo gut. 
Aber heute werden die neuen Killer immer absurder, die Community immer toxischer und das Spiel immer verbuggter.

Juego bello, hermoso, sexy, zukulento, zukistrukis y mucho mas, deberías comprarlo, si juegas como superviviente tendrás que reparar un total de 5 generadores con 3 personas mas, habrá un asesino, este los intentara sacrificarlos al ente tirándolos al suelo y colgándolos en una huevada, podrán tirar pales y otras cosas para detener al asesino un rato y hacer que te pierda de vista, también puedes esconderte en armarios

Como asesino tendrás que golpear a los supervivientes, dañando generadores para que la "vida" de estos se vaya bajando, normalmente en partidas avanzadas va a haber un maldito que te va a intentar hacer perder el tiempo para que el resto del equipo vaya haciendo generadores, haciéndote looping entre otras cosas

es un pequeño resumen, no es todo, en este juego puedes jugar con amigos, en partidas publicas como superviviente o en partidas custom, en partidas custom podrás equiparte con perks de todos los asesinos/supervivientes sin necesidad de tenerlos al nivel requerido o haberlos comprado, podras equiparte con 4 perks sin tener el nivel 15 en el personaje en el que juegues, tendrás todas las ofrendas de manera ilimitada igual que los add-ons 

como dije arriba no es todo, te recomiendo comprarlo y más si tienes un amigo con el juego comprado por steam o por epic games

Es un juego que da para muchas horas, sobretodo si se juega con amigos en equipo de 4 como supervivientes, y desde el lado del asesino hay una buena variedad de asesinos con estilos de juegos distintos por lo que es muy probable que acabes encontrando el personaje que se adapte a tu estilo de juego.

After 200+ hours, I realized that this game was not created for people with weak nerves
Here you are 99% likely to suffer, especially if you want to climb to the maximum ranks
And if you can still win for a maniac (after all, you play for yourself, and the outcome of the game depends on your actions), then for the survivors, the outcome of the game also depends on your teammates, who often suffer from garbage in the game
Oh yes, even angry comments will constantly appear in your profile, from these same teammates who themselves do not know how to play, but writing an insult is the main thing for them
But despite all this - I advise, because the game costs a couple of hundred hours

Overall, the game is alright, at least if you play as killer or play survivor with friends. Playing as survivor on your own isn't very enjoyable.
The community is incredibly toxic, and there are more matches where you get taunted by survivors when playing as killer than ones where you don't. Add to that the incredibly steep learning curve, the balancing issues, the expensive microtransactions for new DLCs and the tedious grinding to get better perks, and you end up with a very mixed experience.
I'd say the game is worth the price when it's on sale, so I'll give it a "recommended" rating with some big caveats.
